pull.title: Doc: Fix BSD docs regarding gmake

events.body: Adding `MAKE=gmake` as an argument to the `./configure` command line examples might be preferable, as `setenv` is specific to `csh`.

I'm still confused why this is needed. I've been running a node on a FreeBSD machine for years, and never had to redefine `MAKE`.

A clean checkout of master on FreeBSD 12.0-RELEASE-p10:
```
user@medea:~/src/bitcoin % echo $MAKE
MAKE: Undefined variable.
user@medea:~/src/bitcoin % ./autogen.sh
…
user@medea:~/src/bitcoin % ./configure --disable-wallet --disable-dependency-tracking
checking build system type... amd64-unknown-freebsd12.0  
checking host system type... amd64-unknown-freebsd12.0
…
user@medea:~/src/bitcoin % gmake -j4
…
user@medea:~/src/bitcoin % size src/bitcoind
     text    data     bss       dec        hex   filename
  5594825   59184   19896   5673905   0x5693b1   src/bitcoind
```

Do you need this when building other autoconf projects as well? If not, I wonder what is different in our build system.
So it's an alternative for `--disable-dependency-tracking`? Makes sense then.
I agree with the other commenters in using [`./configure MAKE=gmake`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/14404#issuecomment-431565631).

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -36,7 +36,10 @@ export BDB_PREFIX="$PWD/db4"
 
 ## Building Bitcoin Core
 
-**Important**: Use `gmake` (the non-GNU `make` will exit with an error):
+**Important**: Use `gmake` (the non-GNU `make` will exit with an error).
+```shell
+setenv MAKE gmake
+```
comments.body:
`setenv` is not portable between shells. Yes, it works on the default `csh` but does not work in others.

Given that `./configure MAKE=gmake` is an equivalent and works with any shell, I would suggest to add `MAKE=gmake` a few lines below where we show how to execute `./configure`.
